description.narrative: Uso sostenible y conservación de la biodiversidad en bosques secos para garantizar el flujo de los servicios ecosistémicos y mitigar procesos de deforestación y desertificación en la región del Caribe y el Valle Interandino del río Magdalena.

description.narrative: Delivery of multiple global environmental benefits through the declaration of PAs andor conservation agreements REDD practices and SLM activities that strengthen the conservation and sustainable use of dry ecosystems
Area in hectares of dry forest under implementation of REDD activities by the end of the project

comment.narrative: With technical support from the IDEAM dry forest hectares affected by sustainable forest management activities REDD are being recalculated This depends of the carbon units content based on the dry forest cartography created by this institute in 2013 According to this calculation the amount of hectares is susceptible to changes which will be promptly reported once the information is delivered by the IDEAM

With technical support from the IDEAM dry forest hectares affected by sustainable forest management activities REDD are being recalculated This depends of the carbon units content based on the dry forest cartography created by this institute in 2013 According to this calculation the amount of hectares is susceptible to changes which will be promptly reported once the information is delivered by the IDEAM

description.narrative: Area in hectares of rehabilitated dry forest

comment.narrative:
The following actions have been undertaken regarding implementation of landscape management tools to contribute to the maintenance of water flows and reduction of degradation and desertification
A Identification of areas of conservation value for the design and establishment of landscape management tools HMP in its Spanish acronym in tropical dry forest bsT in its Spanish acronyn for the prioritized basins three in the Caribbean region and three in the Andean region The areas with conservation value were established not only according to indicator biological groups but based on the ecosystem service offer 6 maps were created one per basin identifying areas of conservation value
B Design of a conservation corridor and process of socioeconomic characterization of lands with local actors of the prioritized basins in the Caribbean region
C Monitoring protocols for indicators of ecosystem functions water and soil in 6 basins prioritized for the implementation of landscape management tools
D Methodology for the design and conciliation procedure negotiation of a model for the process of participative plot planning model for the design of landscape management tools
E Agreements were reached with Corpoguajira and Los Colorados Flora and Fauna Sanctuary to set up plant nurseries In this respect a technical proposal was prepared for the production of vegetal material to set up the landscape management tools

The following actions have been undertaken regarding implementation of landscape management tools to contribute to the maintenance of water flows and reduction of degradation and desertification
A Identification of areas of conservation value for the design and establishment of landscape management tools HMP in its Spanish acronym in tropical dry forest bsT in its Spanish acronyn for the prioritized basins three in the Caribbean region and three in the Andean region The areas with conservation value were established not only according to indicator biological groups but based on the ecosystem service offer 6 maps were created one per basin identifying areas of conservation value
B Design of a conservation corridor and process of socioeconomic characterization of lands with local actors of the prioritized basins in the Caribbean region
C Monitoring protocols for indicators of ecosystem functions water and soil in 6 basins prioritized for the implementation of landscape management tools
D Methodology for the design and conciliation procedure negotiation of a model for the process of participative plot planning model for the design of landscape management tools
E Agreements were reached with Corpoguajira and Los Colorados Flora and Fauna Sanctuary to set up plant nurseries In this respect a technical proposal was prepared for the production of vegetal material to set up the landscape management tools

description.narrative: Avoided deforestation in hectares by the end of the project

comment.narrative:
Garupal River Basin 52265 ha
Dagua River Basin 44542 ha

description.narrative: Management effectiveness of two protected areas with dry forest measured through the METT score sheet based on the effectiveness analysis used at the national level

comment.narrative:
Integrated Management District DMI of Atuncela 4902
Land Conservation District DCS of Río Grande 0
It will be confirmed in the projects midterm evaluation

Integrated Management District of Atuncela 5902
Land Conservation District DCS of Río Grande 10
Increases by 10 according to baseline

The project developed a prioritization exercise and agreed that it is not costeffective to work in Ceibotes and Besotes because these two protected areas are outside of the prioritized areas of the project therefore actions to be conducted will not benefit these two areas Thus the work will be done in the Land Conservation District of Río Grande located in the basin of the Dagua River Therefore the following change to the indicator is proposed Change in management effectiveness of two dry forest protected areas measured through the METT score sheet based on management effectiveness assessments which are used at the regional level The goal will focus on the protected areas The Integrated Management District of Atuncela and the Land Conservation District of Río Grande both of the areas located in the basin of the Dagua River Based on the above a form was sent to CVC regarding the two protected areas The Integrated Management District of Atuncela and the Land Conservation District of Río Grande Through this form the baseline for the Atuncela DMI will be confirmed and the baseline for the Río Grande DCS will be established

Integrated Management District of Atuncela 5902
Land Conservation District DCS of Río Grande 10
Increases by 10 according to baseline

The project developed a prioritization exercise and agreed that it is not costeffective to work in Ceibotes and Besotes because these two protected areas are outside of the prioritized areas of the project therefore actions to be conducted will not benefit these two areas Thus the work will be done in the Land Conservation District of Río Grande located in the basin of the Dagua River Therefore the following change to the indicator is proposed Change in management effectiveness of two dry forest protected areas measured through the METT score sheet based on management effectiveness assessments which are used at the regional level The goal will focus on the protected areas The Integrated Management District of Atuncela and the Land Conservation District of Río Grande both of the areas located in the basin of the Dagua River Based on the above a form was sent to CVC regarding the two protected areas The Integrated Management District of Atuncela and the Land Conservation District of Río Grande Through this form the baseline for the Atuncela DMI will be confirmed and the baseline for the Río Grande DCS will be established

description.narrative: Change in the financial capacity for the management of the protected areas with dry forest as stated through the total average score obtained in the Financial Sustainability Sheet tracking tool

comment.narrative:
Legal regulatory and institutional frameworks 2632
Business planning and costeffective management tools 36
Income generation tools for protected areas 25
Total 2844
Note the baseline and the goal will be confirmed during the projects first year of implementation

Legal regulatory and institutional frameworks 3632
Business planning and tools for costeffective management 46
Income generation tools for protected areas 35
Total 3844

The project developed a prioritization exercise and agreed that it is not costeffective to work in Ceibotes and Besotes because these two protected areas are outside of the prioritized areas of the project therefore actions to be conducted will not benefit these two areas Thus the work will be done in the Land Conservation District of Río Grande located in the basin of the Dagua River
To date a form has been sent to CVC for the corresponding two protected areas The Integrated Management District of Atuncela and the Land Conservation District of Río Grande Through this form the baseline for the Atuncela DMI will be confirmed and the baseline for the Río Grande DCS will be established

Legal regulatory and institutional frameworks 3632
Business planning and tools for costeffective management 46
Income generation tools for protected areas 35
Total 3844

The project developed a prioritization exercise and agreed that it is not costeffective to work in Ceibotes and Besotes because these two protected areas are outside of the prioritized areas of the project therefore actions to be conducted will not benefit these two areas Thus the work will be done in the Land Conservation District of Río Grande located in the basin of the Dagua River
To date a form has been sent to CVC for the corresponding two protected areas The Integrated Management District of Atuncela and the Land Conservation District of Río Grande Through this form the baseline for the Atuncela DMI will be confirmed and the baseline for the Río Grande DCS will be established

description.narrative: Number of protected areas andor conservation agreements that include dry forest at the national level

comment.narrative:
PAs 25
Conservation agreements 0
It will be confirmed during the projects first year of implementation

PAs Up to 37
Conservation agreements up to 12

The following actions refer to the progress made on defining 12 protected areas andor conservation agreements
A One 1 letter of intention aimed at consolidating the agreement or declaration of conservation areas and sustainable use of the dry forest ecosystem by referendum signed on June 16 2015 by representatives of the community action boards of the municipalities of Aipe and Neiva which belong to the basin of the Aipe and Patá Rivers these areas of influence of the project cover 9107 ha and conform a landscape matrix which is essential for the conservation restauration rehabilitation and sustainable use and the improvement of the dry forests ecological connectivity and functionality
B 301825 ha identified as potential areas for protection and conservation PAsCAs through the following prioritized basins
7198 ha CañasAncho River Dibulla
7698 ha Garupal River Valledupar
64995 ha Arroyo Grande River San Juan Nepomuceno
2770 ha AipePatá River AipeNeiva
3150 ha Yaví River NatagaimaPrado
2867 ha Dagua River Dagua La Cumbre Restrepo and Vijes

PAs Up to 37
Conservation agreements up to 12

description.narrative: Strengthened implementation of the regulatory and land use planning framework facilitates the reduction of dry ecosystem deforestation and desertification processes

Changes in the institutional capacity of CARs based on the UNDP sheet of assessment of capacity development
a Participation capacity
b Capacity of generation access and usage of information and knowledge
c Capacity of development of strategies policies and legislation
d Capacity of management and implementation
e Capacity of monitoring and evaluation

comment.narrative:
Corpoguajira Corpocesar Cortolima CAM CVC
a 20 10 26 23 20
b 18 12 16 16 12
c 26 13 20 26 20
d 15 00 20 20 20
e 30 00 05 25 25

Corpoguajira Corpocesar Cortolima CAM CVC
a 26 16 30 29 26
b 24 18 22 22 18
c 30 19 26 30 26
d 21 06 26 26 26
e 30 06 11 30 30
Increase of 20 or 06 points 30 being the top score

The following actions have been conducted as part of the CAR capacity assessment
A 6 UNDP capacity assessment forms sent to CARs to be completed CVC CAM Corpoguajira Cortolima Corpocesar and Cardique
B 5 capacity assessment forms filled by CARs and reviewed CVC CAM Corpoguajira Corpocesar and Cardique
Results show that the CARs require substantial strengthening in terms of the handling of GIS tools for environmental planning and for environmental followup and monitoring within their jurisdictions Similarly the CARs continue to show capacity weaknesses in terms of generation access and use of information

description.narrative: Number of professional and technical staff members of CARs MADS IDEAM and local and regional authorities designing and implementing strategies of SLM REDD and biodiversity conservation

comment.narrative:
IDEAM 5
MADS Ministry of the Environment and Sustainable Development 3
CARs 37
Municipal mayors offices 6
Departmental governments 13

IDEAM 10
MADS 10
CARs 87
Municipal mayors offices 18
Departmental governments 20

1 The following actions have been undertaken to implement GIS tools to guide local and regional authorities in planning processes and environmental followup and monitoring
A 6 computers with installed ArcGis license delivered to the CARs as part of the strengthening of Geographic Information Systems to guide processes of planning and for the followup and monitoring of biodiversity sustainable forest management and sustainable land management REDD
2 The following training has been conducted related to education programs for government officers and social organizations
A 6 traininginduction meetings with CAR officers on the handling of GIS tools and computers delivered by the project A total of 14 officers trained 10 men and 4 women
B 6 training workshops on addressing methodologies for the declaration of protected areas andor conservation agreements and the implementation of landscape management tools A total of 127 officers trained 74 men and 53 women

description.narrative: Number of local plans that incorporate strategies of conservation of biodiversity sustainable forest management and sustainable land management

comment.narrative: Regional planning tools land use plan andor municipal development plan andor fouryear action plans of the Autonomous Regional Corporations CARs andor the environmental determinants of the CARs 0
Planning tools land use plan andor municipal development plan andor CAR fouryear action plans andor CAR environmental determinants 12

Progress achieved in the incorporation of biodiversity BD sustainable forest management SFM and sustainable land management SLM conservation strategies into planning relates to processes of change of land use plans second generation that are currently conducted by the municipalities as well as changes on regulatory tools related to environmental guidelines and determinants for land use currently conducted by the CARs
A One 1 document of diagnosis and technical assessment of the environmental component for the 6 municipalities in the work area Natagaima Aipe Dagua Andean region and Dibulla San Juan Nepomuceno and Valledupar Caribbean region
B 3 technical documents prepared with recommendations municipalities of Dibulla Natagaima and Valledupar for the incorporation of biodiversity BD sustainable forest management SFM and sustainable land management SLM in the land use plans
C 2 technical documents sent to the municipalities of Dibulla Natagaima and Valledupar with recommendations for the incorporation of biodiversity BD sustainable forest management SFM and sustainable land management SLM in the land use plans
D 6 technical meetings with the municipalities of Natagaima Dibulla Valledupar San Juan Nepomuceno Aipe Dagua to include dry forest and sustainable land management in land use plans
E One 1 land use plan Valledupar incorporates protection of primary forests including dry forest and high stubbles to land use Valledupars Municipal Council Agreement No 011 from 5June2015
F 4 technical meetings conducted to review environmental determinants Cortolima Corpoguajira Corpocesar CAM
G 4 documents prepared and sent with recommendations of incorporation of dry forest in environmental guidelines and determinants for land use Cortolima Corpoguajira Corpocesar and Cardique
H 2 resolutions from the CARs adopting dry forest as an environmental guideline for land use Cortolima Resolution 560 of 20March2015 and Corpocesar Resolution 0674 of 18June2015
I Elaboration of chapter 24 Sustainable Development and Environmental Management in the UNDPDNPNational Planning Department paper called Orientaciones para la construcción de programas de gobierno Guía para candidatos candidatas y ciudadanía Elecciones de autoridades locales 2015 Guidelines for the construction of government programs A guide for candidates and citizens Local Authority Election 2015 Due to changes in the administration the development of the second generation of the land use plan progresses very slowly this is the reason why the project will have an influence upon other planning tools such as the CAR fouryear action plans and the CAR environmental determinants on land use In this sense it is expected that the goal will be modified as follows 12 planning tools land use plan andor municipal development plan andor CAR fouryear action plans of andor CAR environmental determinants include strategies of conservation of biodiversity BD sustainable forest management SFM and sustainable land management SLM
Planning tools land use plan andor municipal development plan andor CAR fouryear action plans andor CAR environmental determinants 12

Progress achieved in the incorporation of biodiversity BD sustainable forest management SFM and sustainable land management SLM conservation strategies into planning relates to processes of change of land use plans second generation that are currently conducted by the municipalities as well as changes on regulatory tools related to environmental guidelines and determinants for land use currently conducted by the CARs

E One 1 land use plan Valledupar incorporates protection of primary forests including dry forest and high stubbles to land use Valledupars Municipal Council Agreement No 011 from 5June2015
F 4 technical meetings conducted to review environmental determinants Cortolima Corpoguajira Corpocesar CAM
G 4 documents prepared and sent with recommendations of incorporation of dry forest in environmental guidelines and determinants for land use Cortolima Corpoguajira Corpocesar and Cardique
H 2 resolutions from the CARs adopting dry forest as an environmental guideline for land use Cortolima Resolution 560 of 20March2015 and Corpocesar Resolution 0674 of 18June2015
I Elaboration of chapter 24 Sustainable Development and Environmental Management in the UNDPDNPNational Planning Department paper called Orientaciones para la construcción de programas de gobierno Guía para candidatos candidatas y ciudadanía Elecciones de autoridades locales 2015 Guidelines for the construction of government programs A guide for candidates and citizens Local Authority Election 2015 Due to changes in the administration the development of the second generation of the land use plan progresses very slowly this is the reason why the project will have an influence upon other planning tools such as the CAR fouryear action plans and the CAR environmental determinants on land use In this sense it is expected that the goal will be modified as follows 12 planning tools land use plan andor municipal development plan andor CAR fouryear action plans of andor CAR environmental determinants include strategies of conservation of biodiversity BD sustainable forest management SFM and sustainable land management SLM

description.narrative: To reduce the current trend of dry forest deforestation and desertification processes and ensure the flow of multiple global ecosystem services through biodiversity conservation sustainable land management and carbon storage
Carbon units not released as a global benefit by the end of the project

comment.narrative: Carbon units are being recalculated with technical support from the IDEAM Institute of Hydrology Meteorology and Environmental Studies based on the dry forest cartography mapped by this institute in 2013 and the corresponding calculation methodology According to this calculation the goal of 93700 tCO2 is susceptible to changes which will be promptly reported once the information is delivered by the IDEAM Additionally the project held consultations with the Ministry of the Environment and Sustainable Development and the IDEAM regarding the indicator proposed by the project Identified carbon units with capacity of commercialization in the carbon market as of the end of the project In this regard the recommendation is not to address the commercialization in the voluntary carbon market but to link this indicator and its goal to the national priorities In this sense it is expected that the indicator will be modified as follows Carbon units not released as a global benefit by the end of the project

Carbon units are being recalculated with technical support from the IDEAM Institute of Hydrology Meteorology and Environmental Studies based on the dry forest cartography mapped by this institute in 2013 and the corresponding calculation methodology According to this calculation the goal of 93700 tCO2 is susceptible to changes which will be promptly reported once the information is delivered by the IDEAM Additionally the project held consultations with the Ministry of the Environment and Sustainable Development and the IDEAM regarding the indicator proposed by the project Identified carbon units with capacity of commercialization in the carbon market as of the end of the project In this regard the recommendation is not to address the commercialization in the voluntary carbon market but to link this indicator and its goal to the national priorities In this sense it is expected that the indicator will be modified as follows Carbon units not released as a global benefit by the end of the project

description.narrative: Objetivo del proyecto a) Cobertura (ha) de bosque seco y otros ecosistemas secos en APs y/o bajo acuerdos de conservación b) Número de especies clave por grupos biológicos (aves, plantas y hormigas) en parcelas de monitoreo permanentes en los sitios priorizados. Resultado 1 c) Unidades de carbono no liberadas (como un beneficio global) al final del proyecto d) Número de planes locales que incorporan estrategias de conservación de la BD, MSB y MSS. e) Número de profesionales y técnicos de las CAR, MADS, IDEAM y los entes territoriales diseñando e implementando estrategias de MSS, REDD+ y conservación de la BD. f) Cambio en la capacidad institucional de las CAR de acuerdo con la Ficha de Evaluación de Desarrollo de Capacidades del PNUD Resultado 2: g) Número de APs y/o acuerdos de conservación que incluyen bosque seco a nivel nacional. h) Efectividad de manejo de dos APs con bosque seco medido a través de la hoja de calificación METT a partir de los análisis de efectividad del manejo que se utiliza a nivel nacional. i) Cambio en la capacidad financiera para el manejo de las APs con bosque seco según se establece a través del puntaje total promedio en la Ficha de Sostenibilidad Financiera (Tracking tool). j) Área (ha) de bosque seco bajo actividades REDD+ al finalizar el proyecto. k) Reducción de emisiones netas (tCO2-e) (biomasa aérea) por la deforestación evitada al final del proyecto. l) Deforestación evitada (ha) al final del proyecto. m) Caudal aportado (m3/seg) por las UHR (unidad hidrológica de respuesta) en cada cuenca priorizada. n) Pérdida de suelos: Sedimentos (Total de sólidos en suspensión - TSS) aportados por las UHR en cada cuenca priorizada. o) Área (ha) de bosque seco rehabilitada. p) Número de familias que participan en el uso sostenible y conservación del bosque seco. q) Número de cadenas de valor fortalecidas de la biodiversidad y de iniciativas de producción ambientalmente sostenibles.

comment.narrative:
Objetivo del Proyecto: a) 1,370,496 ha de bosque seco y otros ecosistemas secos en APs y/o bajo acuerdos de conservación. b) Especies clave por grupos biológicos (aves, plantas y hormigas) en parcelas de monitoreo permanentes en los sitios priorizados. • Región Caribe: - Aves: 6 - Flora: 8 (árboles) - Hormigas: 2 • Región Valle interandino del Magdalena - Aves:3 - Flora: 5 (árboles) - Hormigas: 2 Resultado 1: c) 2,883,094.41 tCO2 Unidades de carbono no liberadas (como un beneficio global) al final del proyecto d) 0 planes locales que incorporan estrategias de conservación de la BD, MSB y MSS. e) Profesionales y técnicos de las CAR, MADS, IDEAM y los entes territoriales diseñando e implementando estrategias de MSS, REDD+ y conservación de la BD. - Instituto de hidrología, meteorología y estudios ambientales: 5 - Ministerio de Ambiente y Desarrollo Sostenible: 3 - Corporaciones Autónomas Regionales: 37 - Alcaldías: 6 - Gobernaciones: 13 f) Capacidad institucional de las CAR de acuerdo con la Ficha de Evaluación de Desarrollo de Capacidades del PNUD Corpoguajira / Corpocesar / Cortolima / CAM / CVC - Participación. 2.0 / 1.0 / 2.6 / 2.3 / 2.0 - Uso de información. 1.8 /1.2 / 1.6 / 1.6 / 1.2 - Desarrollo de políticas y legislación. 2.6 / 1.3 / 2.0 / 2.6 / 2.0 - Manejo e implementación. 1.5 / 0.0 / 2.0 / 2.0 / 2.0 - Monitoreo y evaluación: 3.0 / 0.0 / 0.5 / 2.5 / 2.5
Resultado 2: g) 25 APs y/o acuerdos de conservación que incluyen bosque seco a nivel nacional. h) Efectividad de manejo dos APs con bosque seco medido a través de la hoja de calificación METT a partir de los análisis de efectividad del manejo que se utiliza a nivel nacional. - Distrito de Manejo Integrado Atuncela: 68% - (Distrito de Conservación de Suelos) Cañón del Río Grande*: 67% i) Capacidad financiera para el manejo de las APS con Bosque seco: - Marcos legales, normativos e institucionales: 5,26% - Planificación empresarial y herramientas para el manejo costo efectivo: 0% - He

a) Elaborar y socializar las estrategias de cierre y sostenibilidad de todos los componente del proyecto b)Realizar 6 talleres de cierre comunitarios regionales en cada una de las zonas de trabajo c)Edición de las publicaciones del proyecto d) Realizar el taller de Cierre nacional del proyecto e) Elaboración de informes finales del proyecto.

a) el proyecto elaboró la estrategia de cierre y sostenibilidad para las 6 áreas y la socializo y compartió con las entidades locales y el Ministerio de ambiente b) el proyecto finalizo en el primer trimestre del año las reuniones de socialización comunitarias c) las publicaciones fueron editadas d) el proyecto realizó evento de cierre con Semana sostenible e) el proyecto realizó el informe final y el de lecciones aprendidas

a)6 (seis) POT/POMCAS con recomendaciones de incorporación de las actividades y resultados del proyecto b) 6 (seis) Estrategias participativas de salida del proyecto, elaboradas conjuntamente con las CARs y municipios. c)Formulación del Programa Nacional para la Gestión Integral del Bosque seco de Colombia d)6 (seis) protocolos participativos elaborados con las CAR sobre estándares y lineamientos para la organización y almacenamiento de la información SIG y sostenibilidad e)Monitoreo de la dinámica de cambio en las coberturas vegetales zonas de implementación del proyecto, incluye compra de imágenes satelitales para el monitoreo f)Medición del cambio en la efectividad de manejo dos APs con bosque seco a través de la hoja de calificación METT a partir de los análisis de efectividad del manejo que se utiliza a nivel nacional g)Medición del cambio en la capacidad financiera para el manejo de las APs con bosque seco según se establece a través del puntaje total promedio en la Ficha de Sostenibilidad Financiera (Tracking tool). h)Medición de las unidades de carbono no liberadas (como beneficio global) i)10 organizaciones fortalecidas en cadenas de valor de la biodiversidad y encadenamientos productivos sostenibles. Consolidación de la oferta de productos sostenibles j)Recálculo para las seis cuencas de área (ha) de bosque seco bajo actividades de reducción de emisiones

a) se cuenta con 6 documentos borrador b)se esta consolidando la estrategia de salida c) se continua en la elaboración del Programa nacional gestión integral del Bosque seco d) Los protocolos se encuentra en versión de revisión de revisión para las Corporaciones f) se realizo la medición de la efectividad de manejo g) se realizo la medición de la capacidad de manejo financiera de las áreas protegidas de la región de CVC h) se hizo la medición de las unidades de carbono no liberadas i) Se continua en el proceso de consolidación de la oferta de productos sostenibles j) se hizo el calculo de las áreas de deforestación evitada.

a) 18000 ha gestionadas como áreas protegidas/acuerdos de conservación b) Monitoreo grupos biológicos d) Estrategias participativas de cierre en proceso de elaboración conjuntamente con las CARs. f) Protocolos participativos en proceso de elaboración sobre estándares y lineamientos para la organización y almacenamiento de la información SIG o) Restauración mediante HMP p) 400 familias fortalecidas e implementando acciones para la conservación de los ecosistemas secos. q) 10 organizaciones fortalecidas en cadenas de valor de la biodiversidad y encadenamientos productivos sostenibles.

a) Áreas protegidas / acuerdos de conservación: - Una (1) Estrategia Complementaria de Conservación gestionada y adoptada en la cuenca Yaví y Plan de trabajo elaborado - Cuatro (4) documentos de AP en revisión, análisis e identificación de vacíos y necesidades de complementación: DMI Dibulla (Guajira), DCS Garupal-Diluvio (Cesar), Corredor Arroyo Grande (Bolívar) y Dagua (Valle del Cauca). - 12 RNSC constituidas en Aipe - Socialización por parte de PNN de la Guía para la elaboración de planes de manejo de las RNSC - Articulación con ASOBOSPA (Asociación de mujeres del Bosque Seco, ONG), para el proceso de formulación de Planes de los Manejo de las RNSC
b) Listados de especies para los 4 grupos biológicos (monitoreo científico) Monitoreo de grupos biológicos: - Recensos de grupos biológicos en época de lluvias - contrastante al primer muestreo (época seca) - Monitoreo científico cuencas de la región andina/pacífica: - Aves: 393 especies - Plantas: 332 especies - Hormigas: 139 especies - Mamíferos: 34 especies - Monitoreo científico cuencas de la región caribe: - Aves: 428 especies - Plantas: 479 especies - Hormigas: 297 especies - Mamíferos: 46 especies - Publicaciones guía de especies y cartillas de monitoreo participativo - Expedición Bosque Seco - salida gráfica de todos los contenidos, enlazados y disponibles en la web - https://spark.adobe.com/page/Oa2ytZhkkYnvC/ - https://spark.adobe.com/page/yHhVoLrIuYDEc/ - https://spark.adobe.com/page/PdRQ091QHruhb/ - https://spark.adobe.com/page/cJk9UCYSK46o9/
d) Estrategia participativa de cierre del proyecto: - Realización de Comité Técnico preparatorio estrategia de cierre y sostenibilidad del proyecto - Recolección de información lecciones aprendidas componente Política y Planificación. - Documento de avance de la estrategia de cierre de las actividades del proyecto - Documento de avance con propuesta de incorporación de las actividades del proyecto en los instrumentos de planificación (PDM, POT, DO, PAI)
e) 95 funcionarios del SINA capacitados: “Curso virtual en OAT, GIR y CC para autoridades ambientales en Colombia” (2018) 75 funcionarios del SINA capacitados: “Curso virtual en Gestión Integral del Recurso Hídrico POMCAS, Conflictos y Acuíferos” (2018)
f) Estándares y lineamientos para la organización y almacenamiento de la información SIG: - 3 jornadas: Cardique, Cortolima y Corpoguajira, para avanzar en la elaboración del protocolo de organización y estandarización de la información espacial - 3 CAR Cardique, Corpoguajira y Cortolima, con estructura de almacenamiento de la información organizada y en seguimiento - 5 jornadas de trabajo con la oficina de gestión de calidad de Cardique (2), Corpocesar, Corpoguajira y Cortolima en las para la propuesta de procedimiento en el manejo de la información geográfica - 7 jornadas de acompañamiento al proceso de organización y estandarización de la información geográfica con Cardique (2), Corpocesar, Corpoguajira (2), Cortolima y CVC o) Respecto del área de bosque seco rehabilitada - 1.548 ha de restauraciones en mantenimiento (HMP): - 61 acuerdos de conservación firmados, fortalecimiento y empoderamiento del rol Guardianes del Bosque Seco y 61 Planes Adaptativos Prediales Participativos elaborados - 3 viveros principales (Palomino, Santuario de Flora y Fauna Los Colorados y Aipe), 14 viveros auxiliares en producción para las resiembras, siembra de años 2 y 3
p) Respecto del trabajo con familias que participan en el uso sostenible y la conservación del bosque seco - Implementación del Plan Participativo para la prevención de Incendios forestales en el bosque seco. - Talleres comunitarios realizados para la formulación de la estrategia de cierre del proyecto. - Promoción de la participación de la mujer en los procesos participativos y proyectos productivos - Acompañamiento a la formalización del grupo de mujeres viveristas mediante la creación de la Fundación Miramar en La Guajira. - Acompañamiento a la formulación y presentación de planes de negocios en la convocatoria del Fondo Emprender. Una organización seleccionada por Fondo Emprender - Acompañamiento a organizaciones convocatorias en línea: A ciencia Cierta. Asobrasilar y Brigadas comunitarias para la prevención de incendios forestales seleccionadas y ganadoras. - Acompañamiento a Asobospa (Aipe) para aplicar a la convocatoria de los Premios Caracol a la protección del Medio Ambiente. Ganadora del segundo puesto en la categoría de Organizaciones de Base. - Realización de giras Guardabosques para el conocimiento de actividades desarrolladas en el marco del proyecto en las áreas del proyecto. - Realización encuentro intercambio de semillas de los ecosistemas secos - Fortalecimiento de PRAES - Apoyo en la formulación de perfiles de proyectos para la autogestión. - Acompañamiento a reuniones para la comercialización de productos a nivel local. q) Respecto de cadenas de valor de la biodiversidad • 10 organizaciones en fortalecimiento e implementación de cadenas de valor: - 3 en Guajira (APOMD, ASOREAGRO, Red Ecoagro) - 3 en Bolívar (ASOBRASILAR, ASOAGRO, ASOMUDEPAS) - 2 en Huila (ASOSANDIEGO y Red Turismo) - 1 en Tolima (Artesanas del totumo en Pocharco) - 1 en Valle (hortalizas) • Consolidación de la cadena de valor de turismo del bosque seco en Aipe: ASOBOSPA • 6 Grants firmados con organizaciones del caribe • 6 acuerdos de conservación con 6 organizaciones del caribe • 30 acuerdos de conservación firmados por 30 familias en Bolívar • 4 iniciativas presentadas convocatorias a ciencia cierta de COLCIENCIAS. Dos organizaciones ganaron la convocatoria (50 millones para C/U) • Presentación de la matriz de principios y criterios de las asociaciones de Bolívar y Guajira para el catálogo de negocios verdes del MADS
actividades finalizadas 2020
